welcomePage.title: Eclipse C/C++ Development Tools CppUnit Integration
welcomePage.intro: This page will help familiarize you with the CppUnit integration in the Eclipse C/C++ Development Tools. To use this plugin, you will need to have the CppUnit framework installed. Read the section below, and click on related links.
welcomePage.item: The CppUnit Wizards To create a new test case, select the menu File > New > Other... open the C++ category, and choose to create a new test case. When finished, a template of a test driver and a .mk makefile file are generated. To build the test, adapt and include the .mk in your existing Makefile, and build the test from the Make Target View.

Running a test To run any CppUnit test program, click on Run > Run.... Select CppUnit as the launch configuration and click New. Identify the test program in the Project and the CppUnit Test fields and then click Run. The CppUnit result view will be displayed with the results.

Install CppUnit To use this plugin, you need to have the CppUnit framework installed locally on your computer. To do this, download CppUnit and have it installed. For Windows machine, you will need configure and gcc tools.
Learn more on CppUnit To learn more you can browse the CppUnit documentation
